title: 15 Classic Trench Coats You’ll Have in Your Closet Forever
excerpt: A trench coat is a timeless style everyone should have in their wardrobe. Shop our top picks for the classic outerwear, from traditional colors to modern takes.
text: Cropped Cut Massimo Dutti Short Cotton Blend CapeFor shorter shoppers, longline silhouettes can feel daunting. If you feel like your frame drowns in maxi coats, a cropped iteration might just the thing for you. Structured & Durable Everlane The Mac CoatIf you want a more structured silhouette, look no further. This boxy Everlane option comes in three neutral colors, including a posh olive green. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowHeritage Brand Coach Relaxed TrenchA Coach trench will stand the test of time, and this updated version checks all of the boxes. It’s not too long and has an adjustable belt, making it the perfect finishing touch for all your spring ’fits. Beautifully PracticalSouer Dino Long Cotton Gabardine Trench CoatFashion marries function with this water-repellent coat from Souer. Why compromise on one or the other when you can have both? Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowEditor Favorite Sézane Clyde Trench Coat Designed for modern layering, this fan-favorite from Sézane is lightweight and relaxed, making it a perfect layer for unpredictable spring weather.Expertly Tailored St. Agni Classic Trench CoatYou can always look to St. Agni for subtle sophistication. Classic but modern, this pick is one of my favorites. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowTraditional & Affordable Mango Classic Trench with Belt This jacket proves that basics can really go the distance. Pair it with a button-up shirt, jeans, and mesh heels, and you have yourself a spring uniform.Soft Cotton The Row Domeka Oversize Cotton Twill Trench CoatYou can always expect refreshing designs from The Row, and this one is no different. This cotton twill layer will make you an instant fan of the brand if you aren’t already. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowClassic Crossover Reformation Hayes Denim Trench Coat I swear by a denim trench, and this one should be a strong contender for your next purchase. It combines America’s favorite fabric with a timeless silhouette. Olive Tone Loewe Belted Cotton Drill Trench CoatWith an eye-catching silhouette and olive hue, this iteration is one you should have on your radar. It’s sophisticated, can be dressed up or down, and cinches flawlessly at the waist. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowTouch of Grey Banana Republic Water-Repellant Italian Wool Trench CoatLooking for a neutral trench that isn’t tan or black? This option from Banana Republic will go with just about everything.Ultra Luxury Prada Single-Breasted Cotton Twill Trench CoatELLE editors have been obsessed with belted bags lately, so it stands to reason that this accented Prada trench is also a standout. (Pssst...there’s also a cropped version.) Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowIconic InvestmentBurberry Kensington Cotton Trench Coat When you think of trench coats, you probably think of Burberry. An investment you can wear for decades, there’s a good reason the Kensington endures after all this time. Edgy Option Ganni Bonded Cotton Trench CoatFor a dose of rock and roll, Ganni is serving up this style with double grommeted belts. It’s also available in khaki in case you’re interested in a happy medium. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowLeather Essential Ducie Corrin Leather Trench CoatDon’t be intimidated by leather! Paired with skirts, trousers, or denim, it can be a striking and fun addition to your wardrobe. Plus, all the It girls have been wearing leather trenches this year. html:
Cropped Cut

Massimo Dutti Short Cotton Blend Cape

For shorter shoppers, longline silhouettes can feel daunting. If you feel like your frame drowns in maxi coats, a cropped iteration might just the thing for you.

Structured & Durable

Everlane The Mac Coat

If you want a more structured silhouette, look no further. This boxy Everlane option comes in three neutral colors, including a posh olive green.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Heritage Brand

Coach Relaxed Trench

A Coach trench will stand the test of time, and this updated version checks all of the boxes. It’s not too long and has an adjustable belt, making it the perfect finishing touch for all your spring ’fits.

Beautifully Practical

Souer Dino Long Cotton Gabardine Trench Coat

Fashion marries function with this water-repellent coat from Souer. Why compromise on one or the other when you can have both?

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Editor Favorite

Sézane Clyde Trench Coat

Designed for modern layering, this fan-favorite from Sézane is lightweight and relaxed, making it a perfect layer for unpredictable spring weather.

Expertly Tailored

St. Agni Classic Trench Coat

You can always look to St. Agni for subtle sophistication. Classic but modern, this pick is one of my favorites.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Traditional & Affordable

Mango Classic Trench with Belt

This jacket proves that basics can really go the distance. Pair it with a button-up shirt, jeans, and mesh heels, and you have yourself a spring uniform.

Soft Cotton

The Row Domeka Oversize Cotton Twill Trench Coat

You can always expect refreshing designs from The Row, and this one is no different. This cotton twill layer will make you an instant fan of the brand if you aren’t already.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Classic Crossover

Reformation Hayes Denim Trench Coat

I swear by a denim trench, and this one should be a strong contender for your next purchase. It combines America’s favorite fabric with a timeless silhouette.

Olive Tone

Loewe Belted Cotton Drill Trench Coat

With an eye-catching silhouette and olive hue, this iteration is one you should have on your radar. It’s sophisticated, can be dressed up or down, and cinches flawlessly at the waist.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Touch of Grey

Banana Republic Water-Repellant Italian Wool Trench Coat

Looking for a neutral trench that isn’t tan or black? This option from Banana Republic will go with just about everything.

Ultra Luxury

Prada Single-Breasted Cotton Twill Trench Coat

ELLE editors have been obsessed with belted bags lately, so it stands to reason that this accented Prada trench is also a standout. (Pssst...there’s also a cropped version.)

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Iconic Investment

Burberry Kensington Cotton Trench Coat

When you think of trench coats, you probably think of Burberry. An investment you can wear for decades, there’s a good reason the Kensington endures after all this time.

Edgy Option

Ganni Bonded Cotton Trench Coat

For a dose of rock and roll, Ganni is serving up this style with double grommeted belts. It’s also available in khaki in case you’re interested in a happy medium.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Leather Essential

Ducie Corrin Leather Trench Coat

Don’t be intimidated by leather! Paired with skirts, trousers, or denim, it can be a striking and fun addition to your wardrobe. Plus, all the It girls have been wearing leather trenches this year.

Why Trust ELLE

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below
